LIST.TITLE: Access Control Lists
LIST.DESCRIPTION: These are lists that can be configured as part of rules in rulesets.

EDITRULE.TITLE: Edit Rule
EDITRULE.OUTCOME_DESC: These are used to map outcomes provided by the external provider to determine the final outcomes.

DESC.LABEL: Description
DESC.DESCRIPTION: Good description to identify the rule.

ACTIONSUCCESS.LABEL: Action (If Success)
ACTIONSUCCESS.DESCRIPTION: Action to take if this rule was successful.

ACTIONFAILED.LABEL: Action (If Failed)
ACTIONFAILED.DESCRIPTION: Action to take if this rule was unsuccessful.

ACTIONS.ACCEPT_VERIFY_DESC: Stop processing, flag player as externally verified, then return success

VIEW.TITLE: Access Control Ruleset
VIEW.DESCRIPTION: Review the access ruleset, and if you have the access to do so, add/remove an ACL or modify an existing ACLs properties
VIEW.HELP: Use the control's below to setup the access ruleset. Make use of the test interface to test your configuration for each scenario.

DOMAIN.LABEL: Domain
DOMAIN.DESCRIPTION: The domain for which this access ruleset will be created

NAME.LABEL: Name
NAME.DESCRIPTION: The unique name for this access ruleset
NAME.UNIQUE: The access ruleset name is not unique for this domain
NAME.PATTERN: Only letters, numbers, underscores, and dots allowed

DESC.LABEL: Description
DESC.DESCRIPTION: The description of this access ruleset

STATUS.LABEL: Enabled
STATUS.DESCRIPTION: Should this access ruleset be enabled?
